comments:
Got the following NPE expanding a variable in the variables view:

e(DeferredVariable.java:123)

e(DeferredVariable.java:107)

en(DeferredVariable.java:69)

(DeferredVariable.java:43)
at 
org.eclipse.debug.ui.DeferredDebugElementWorkbenchAdapter.fetchDeferredChildren
(DeferredDebugElementWorkbenchAdapter.java:58)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.RemoteTreeContentManager$4.run
(RemoteTreeContentManager.java:257)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

Steps to reproduce:

* Put a breakpoint in MessageResourceBundle#load
* Start stepping through, and step into "properties.load(input);"
* Turn on logical structures
* Expand the first variable - this= MessageResourceBundle$MessagesProperties

This occurrs when debugging in a Target VM that is not part of the workspace 
java model. In this case, a Java model element cannot be found that 
corresponds to the "Map" interfaces, and we have no project in which to 
perform the evaluation.

There are two things to consider:
(1) our implementation of ILogicalStructureDelegate (JavaLogicalStructure) is 
returning null, when the spec does not allow it (should throw an exception 
instead)
(2) in this case we might be able to resolve a project

This happens when the receiving type and stack frame orginate from 
an "external" source (i.e not part of the Java model). Fix is to return the 
original value rather than a logical value (user sees actual value in this 
case). It would be nice to tell the user what happenned as they might be 
confused. I will enter a seperate enhancement request for this, which will 
have to be a readme for 3.1.

Fixed in JavaLogicalStructure.
